page.title: 02CHOOSING A COUNTRY LIFE.
page.content: Daniel and James decided to find out about how the population has changed in our {D-Block}over the years.We wanted to find out how long people have lived in the area and their reasons for choosing to live in a rural environment.Most people in Easthorpe said they liked living in the area because it has a friendly community and it is peaceful and is out of the town and in the country.Some people said they don't like it because there are not very many facilities,for example no shops.The average length of time for living in that area is round about 16 years.Most housing in the area was built prior to the war.In Easthorpe there are still some prefabricated dwellings.There is also an estate in the area that is 15 years old.
